profile.heading: Profile
profile.subtitle: PhD Candidate in Analytical Chemistry (Expected to graduate by 11/2021)

items.summary:
_OMFPs are fluorescent proteins (FP) discovered by us, which show potentials in revolutionizing cellular imaging._
- Developed and implemented innovative approaches to discover, understand, and connect experimental data from multiple sources programmatically. Extracted key information from overwhelming background noise.
- True reference-free and background-free cell images are obtained by performing fast Fourier transform (FFT) on time-series cell fluorescence using in-house programs written in Python, Matlab, and Mathematica.
items.title: Background / Reference - Free Cellular Imaging with Optically Modulatable Fluorescent Proteins (OMFP) and digital signal processing (DPS)

items.summary:
_OMFPs fluorescence intensity can be modulated by co-illumination with photons more red-shifted than fluorescence._
- Used site-directed mutagenesis to engineer novel OMFPs based on intramolecular interactions from the core and surroundings using computer-assisted 3D modeling with open-source software in Python.
- Worked in a highly collaborative engineering / research team to streamline and implement experiment sequences. Achieved high time efficiency while kept the cost manageable.
items.title: Optically Modulatable Fluorescent Protein Engineering
Optically Activated Delayed Fluorescence (OADF) Among FPs

items.summary:
___Research Interest:__ Data visualization and signal processing, photophysics study/modeling for chromophores, optical cellular imaging, computer-aided fluorescence protein engineering_

- Discrete Fourier Transform based background-free fluorescence imaging, application of digital signal processing in cellular studies for true reference-free and background-free imaging.
- Probing fluorescent protein photophysics, simulation with Python based modeling and data visualization techniques.
- Incorporation of compressive sensing, a signal processing technique for efficient signal acquisition and reconstruction, in fluorescence imaging.
items.title: Mathematical Modeling of FP Photophysics

items.summary:
_Retention projection is an extremely accurate way to predict LC/GC retention time, and has been used as a novel approach for compound identification / differentiation._
- Used 20+ calibration compounds to accurately obtain thermodynamic parameters for each column, thereby to predict, identify, and differentiate isomers.
- Backend functions and APIs were implemented in Java (prototyped in VBA) with a user-friendly interface. Open-sourced on Github.
items.title: GC/HPLC Retention Time Predictor

items.summary:
###### _Research Laboratory Safety Representative_
-  Worked with Environmental Health and Safety Department and participated in cross-organizational processes to ensure public health, safety, env. protection regulations and compliance responsibilities are fulfilled in a timely manner.
- Used strong written / verbal communication skill to consult with members. Maintained and actively tracked safety and training records to facilitate completion of their work in a safe and compliant manner. Ensured internal best practices.

###### _Graduate Teaching Assistant_
- Engaged students into "open conversions". Designed advanced team building. 
- Worked with faculty members to develop personalized long-term plans for students.
- Assisted in the design and implementation of a Python programming class.

items.company: Department of Horticultural Science - University Of Minnesota
items.summary:
###### _Gas Chromatography (GC) Retention Time Projection_
- Accurately predicted retention times from existing calibration data by implementing a well-documented and continuously improving workflow.
- Designed algorithms to streamline and automate processes in obtaining experimental data with advanced liquid handling robotics.
###### _Mentoring Project SEED (Summer Experiences for the Economically Disadvantaged) Students_
- Defined expectations clearly for students and nurtured their self-sufficiency.
- Provided technical and safety training. Gave meaningful research suggestions.
